name: Zen of Programming
description: I wanted to build a blog that would appeal to me, and especially to pre-software engineer me. I want to show that people like me do exist in this industry and show a snapshot into my life as a developer. It's a combination of the lifestyle blogs I love to follow, technical posts, and the cultural critiques I occasionally like to dish out. I post on average twice a week.

name: zen-of-programming.com
description: Progressive Web Application for my blog. Created and customized using Gatsby.js, a static website framework built on top of React. I use GraphQL to query the Markdown posts my posts are written in.

name: All Blog Posts
description: I have a variety of blog posts hosted on dev.to, including posts on Go, Angular, Hyperapp, CSS, and blogging.

name: Sudoku Solver
description: Python implementation of the backtracking algorithm for solving Sudoku puzzles!

name: SnapChat Filters in JavaScript
description: Facial detection application that recreates some of SnapChat's filters and applies them to the user's webcam!

name: Political Discussion
description: Django application that retrieved and stored Tweets about the US Senators. It then performs statistical analyses to test whether certain politicians are discussed differently online across party and gender lines. Finally, the data was displayed using dc.js and Google Charts.

name: Flashcards
description: Pulls definitions for user inputted vocab words from the Oxford Dictionary API. Work in progress!

name: Simon
description: Simple JavaScript application that allows a user to play the game Simon. Implemented using a queue data structure.

name: Coding Cheat Sheets
description: Simple JavaScript application that allows a user to play the game Simon. Implemented using a queue data structure.

name: Coding Problems
description: This is my default repository for small projects! A lot of these are from classes I've taken or from competitions I've participated in. Some highlights include the Huffman Encoding algorithm, a random writer, and Google Code Jam solutions.

name: Election Map
description: D3 map that shows the United States' 2016 presidential election results.

name: Tic Tac Toe
description: Simple Tic Tac Toe game in vanilla JavaScript.

name: CSS Flower Art
description: Simple Tic Tac Toe game in vanilla JavaScript.

name: Towers of Hanoi
description: Implementation of the Towers of Hanoi game using Vanilla JavaScript.

name: Elm Trivia
description: Super simple trivia application built completely in Elm using the Elm architecture!

name: Websocket Drawing
description: Websocket-powered websocket app! Inspired by Reddit's /r/place, this app allows users to collaboratively draw with other users.

name: Helpful Coding Resources Frontend
description: Displays awesome resources for use in development in a minimalist single page app!

name: Helpful Coding Resources API
description: CRUD API that keeps track of awesome articles for developers!

name: Hyperapp Quote App
description: Random quote display using hyperapp.

name: Electron Markdown Reader
description: Desktop app for reading markdown files.

name: App Ideas
description: Node, Objection, Knex, and PostgreSQL CRUD API that uses ES7 features. Displays ideas for applications.

name: Rainbow Word Web Components
description: Vanilla JavaScript fancy rainbow letters that I use for personal branding and my slide decks.

name: Art + Code Collective
description: Co-founder of the Art + Code Collective, a monthly meetup group for artists and coders in the DC area. Designed the logo and the website.

name: #ArtTechChat
description: Co-host of #ArtTechChat, a weekly Twitter chat about technology, design, and art.

name: #CodingPuzzles
description: I post code challenges daily on Twitter and Instagram -- these are usually intermediate challenges I find online and solve for practice.
